Description: Bracelet: composed of twenty-seven small rectangular plaques of mother of pearl. One hole in either end of each plaque for threading.
Curator's comments: Also from this burial: beads (1899,1017.6 & 1899,1017.7 & 1899,1017.8). Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, ‘Diospolis Parva: the Cemeteries of Abadiyeh and Hu. 1898-9’ (London, 1901), 46, mentions similar bracelets from Pan Graves in cemetery X without specific reference to this burial; cf. also pl.XL, bottom left; The British Museum, 'Jewellery through 7000 years' [exhibition catalogue] (London, 1976), no. 29.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (640)
